oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Alvin C. York story -- molding new bullets

oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Rural areas; Rifles; Bullets; Ammunition

Ganier, Albert Franklin, 1883-1973; York, Alvin Cullum, 1887-1964; Sergeant York (Motion picture); Tennessee -- Social life and customs; Appalachians (People) -- Tennessee; Rural families -- Appalachian region; Rifle practice
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A participant in a rifle shoot is pictured kneeling on the ground to mold new bullets.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Albert F. Ganier
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The essential frontier skill of molding bullets was passed down from generation to generation and clearly remained alive and well in the Appalachian region at the time this image was taken.
